title: China announces first embodied AI robot to join university classes
content:
On July 28, the second day of the World Artificial Intelligence Conference in Shanghai, the robot "Scholar 01" officially enrolled as a doctoral student in the Drama and Film Studies program at the Shanghai Theatre Academy for the class of 2025, after receiving a virtual red admission notice, according to Xinmin Evening News.

This marks the first time a physically embodied intelligent robot has been admitted as a doctoral student in China. "Scholar 01" is described as the "Embodied Intelligent Performer" "Art and Technology Explorer" and "Digital Opera Inheritor", and will attend classes alongside human doctoral students over the next four years.

Standing 1.75 meters tall and weighing about 30 kilograms, the physical form of "Scholar 01" is an optimized version of the "Walker No. 2" robot, which won third place at the world's first Humanoid Robot Half-Marathon held in Beijing.

Experts explain that "Scholar 01's" curriculum will include foundational modules, artistic modules, system modules, and task modules, covering areas such as perception and cognitive modeling, cross-modal data fusion, and "dissertation defense"-style outcome evaluations.

This robotic doctoral student represents a groundbreaking educational experiment, aiming to integrate generative artificial intelligence into drama creation and embodied intelligence into specialized performance training, embarking on a new interdisciplinary exploration of the "fusion of technology and art."

title: Animal park responds to chimpanzee smoking case, pledging to enhance oversight measures
content:
Recently, a video filmed at Xixiakou Shendiaoshan Wild Animal Park in Weihai, East China's Shandong Province has sent shockwaves online. In the footage, a tourist throws a cigarette to a black chimpanzee in the park, and the chimpanzee, after taking the cigarette, smokes it skillfully, puffing out clouds of white smoke from his mouth.

The video soon spread like wildfire across the internet.

While some people made jokes about this rare scene, many also expressed deep concerns.

Some netizens said that such behavior would not only cause serious harm to the chimpanzee's health, but also show a disregard for animal protection laws.

In response to this incident, zoo staff said: "We absolutely do not condone this behavior of throwing cigarettes. Now it's time for summer vacation, which means it's the perfect time to visit the park. There are lots of tourists here right now. Staff members have the exciting task of patrolling between several animal areas, ensuring the smooth running of the incredible facility."

In the meantime, the staff workers have promised to make some changes. They're going to step up park management to make sure that incidents like this never happen again and that the animals are always safe and sound.

And, netizens also urged tourists to abide by park regulations, visit public places in a civilized manner, and help maintain a safe and healthy living environment for animals.

title: High school student discovers new spider species
content:
In July, the

In 2022, his popular science videos caught the attention of CCTV News Live Broadcast, where he expressed his dream of discovering a new species named after himself.

In 2023, Ni teamed up with Zi Chong, a researcher in spider taxonomy, to search for dung beetles in Minhou. Using his keen observation skills, Ni noticed a spider with unique morphological features and brought it back for study. After preliminary examination, Zi Chong determined that it might be an undocumented new species. Following in-depth research, repeated verification, rigorous paper writing, and a long wait, it was finally confirmed to be a new member of the Guizygiella genus. To honour Ni's discovery, the species was named Haoyang Guizygiella. "It feels like a dream," Ni admitted, saying the unexpected discovery was even more exciting than his original dung beetle research.

title: Ocean or lawn? Yantai coastline swamped by green seaweed
content:
"Sailing a boat across a 'vast green meadow'..." In parts of Yantai, East China's Shandong Province, the sea and beaches have been blanketed by seaweed. On Monday, videos captured by netizens sparked heated discussions after being posted on social media.

In the footage shared online, several people were seen riding a small boat across the sea. Instead of the usual blue, the surrounding water appeared green, with dense clusters of seaweed swaying in the waves. At a glance, it looked as if the boat were gliding over a patch of grassland.

Near a development zone in Yantai, a resident, surnamed Li, also spotted seaweed on the public beach. She provided reporters with a video taken on the afternoon of June 29, showing green seaweed covering the shore, forming a several-meter-wide belt that stretched far along the beach. Li said the recreational space had been taken over by the seaweed, which would soon emit a foul odor.

On Tuesday, staff from Yantai's Ocean Development and Fisheries Bureau said that Shandong Province had activated a pre-emptive cleanup mechanism about 10 days earlier, with Haiyang city already beginning offshore removal efforts. The staff worker said: "The peak period for seaweed outbreaks is typically from June to August. Since late May, we have strengthened monitoring and early warnings, which will continue until the seaweed disappears. Offshore cleanup is ongoing, while seaweed washed ashore is being removed by relevant departments."
